text: Monte Titano ("Mount Titan") is a mountain of the Apennines and the highest peak in San Marino. It is highOfficial Italian 1:25,000 mapping; other sources give slightly higher figures. and is to the east side of the capital, San Marino. It became a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2008 under the combined title "San Marino Historic Centre and Mount Titano". == References == Category:Mountains of Europe Category:World Heritage Sites in Europe Category:San Marino
title: Monte Titano
